Server.Model

Class Shop

  • java.lang.Object
    • Server.Model.Shop
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Shop
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The class which acts as the main Shop, allowing the various classes on the server side to interface with the client side classses through the socket.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Shop(Order o, ItemDatabaseController db, LoginDatabaseController loginDb, SupplierDatabaseController supplierDb, java.net.Socket socket)
      Constructs an object of Shop with the specified objects.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addItem()
      Adds an item based on client input, but return an error through the socket if conditions arent met.
      void decreaseQuantity()
      decreases the stock of an item based on client input, creates a new order if it is required.
      void deleteItem()
      deletes an item from the database based on the clients input
      void displayOrders()
      sends the client the orders to be displayed
      void listAllItems()
      Prints all items in the inventory with their details.
      void listAllSuppliers()
      sends string with all the items on the database.
      int menu()
      Reads input from the client through the socket and returns it.
      void menuRunner()
      Swich statement which receives an integer from the menu() method, calls the method requested by the client.
      void orderMore(int itemId)
      makes a new order for an item and restocks item to 50 if they fall below 40.
      void run()
      The run method which makes this class a runnable, calls the menuRunner() method.
      void search()
      searches for an item based on client input, sends the client item info or an error message if there is no such item.
      void validateLogin()
      Takes login input from the client and compares them to the database of logins to make sure it is valid

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Shop

        public Shop(Order o,
            ItemDatabaseController db,
            LoginDatabaseController loginDb,
            SupplierDatabaseController supplierDb,
            java.net.Socket socket)
        Constructs an object of Shop with the specified objects. Calls functions to intialize the readers and writers for the socket.
        Parameters:
        o - the Order object assigned to Shop.
        db - the database controller for items table.
        loginDb - the database controller for the logins table.
        supplierDb - the database controller for the supplier table.
        socket - the socket to communicate with the client.

    • Method Detail

      • menu

        public int menu()
         throws java.io.IOException
        Reads input from the client through the socket and returns it.
        Returns:
        integer which the client sent.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if there is an issue with the socket.

      • menuRunner

        public void menuRunner()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Swich statement which receives an integer from the menu() method, calls the method requested by the client.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if there is an issue with the socket.

      • orderMore

        public void orderMore(int itemId)
               throws java.io.IOException
        makes a new order for an item and restocks item to 50 if they fall below 40.
        Parameters:
        itemId - the id of the item to be ordered more of
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if there is an issue.
